pdesigns.com.lastorders.ImageHandlers

Class ImageWorker

  • java.lang.Object
    • pdesigns.com.lastorders.ImageHandlers.ImageWorker
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ImageResizer

    public abstract class ImageWorker
extends java.lang.Object
    This class wraps up completing some arbitrary long running work when loading a bitmap to an ImageView. It handles things like using a memory and disk cache, running the work in a background thread and setting a placeholder image.

      • cancelPotentialWork

        public static boolean cancelPotentialWork(java.lang.Object data,
                                          ImageView imageView)
        Returns true if the current work has been canceled or if there was no work in progress on this image view. Returns false if the work in progress deals with the same data. The work is not stopped in that case.
        Parameters:
        data - the data
        imageView - the image view
        Returns:
        the boolean

      • loadImage

        public void loadImage(java.lang.Object data,
                      ImageView imageView)
        Load an image specified by the data parameter into an ImageView (override processBitmap(Object) to define the processing logic). A memory and disk cache will be used if an ImageCache has been added using addImageCache(android.support.v4.app.FragmentManager, ImageCache.ImageCacheParams). If the image is found in the memory cache, it is set immediately, otherwise an AsyncTask will be created to asynchronously load the bitmap.
        Parameters:
        data - The URL of the image to download.
        imageView - The ImageView to bind the downloaded image to.

      • setLoadingImage

        public void setLoadingImage(Bitmap bitmap)
        Set placeholder bitmap that shows when the the background thread is running.
        Parameters:
        bitmap - the bitmap

      • addImageCache

        public void addImageCache(android.support.v4.app.FragmentManager fragmentManager,
                          ImageCache.ImageCacheParams cacheParams)
        Adds an ImageCache to this to handle disk and memory bitmap caching.
        Parameters:

        cacheParams - The cache parameters to use for the image cache.

      • setImageFadeIn

      • processBitmap

        protected abstract Bitmap processBitmap(java.lang.Object data)
        Subclasses should override this to define any processing or work that must happen to produce the final bitmap. This will be executed in a background thread and be long running. For example, you could resize a large bitmap here, or pull down an image from the network.
        Parameters:
        data - The data to identify which image to process, as provided by ImageWorker#loadImage(Object, android.widget.ImageView)
        Returns:
        The processed bitmap

      • getImageCache

        protected ImageCache getImageCache()
        Gets image cache.
        Returns:
        The ImageCache object currently being used by this ImageWorker.

      • setPauseWork

        public void setPauseWork(boolean pauseWork)
        Pause any ongoing background work. This can be used as a temporary measure to improve performance. For example background work could be paused when a ListView or GridView is being scrolled using a android.widget.AbsListView.OnScrollListener to keep scrolling smooth.

        If work is paused, be sure setPauseWork(false) is called again before your fragment or activity is destroyed (for example during android.app.Activity#onPause()), or there is a risk the background thread will never finish.

        Parameters:
        pauseWork - the pause work
